bibl.title: The Aesthetics of Hexameter Verses: A New Fragment on Metre in the Michigan Collection.

series.title: Österreichische Akademie der Wissenschaften. Philosophisch-historische Klasse. Kommission für antike Rechtsgeschichte. Papyrologica Vindobonensia.

bibl.note: P. Mich. Inv. 6766a verso is characterized in the library's inventory as "grammatical treatise". Fr. 3 focuses on metre rather than prosody or grammar in the strict sense. Homeric verses are quoted. Frs. 1 and 2 will be edited elsewhere. Unknown provenance, II century C.E.

bibl.title: Akten des 23. Internationalen Papyrologenkongresses. Wien, 22.-28. Juli 2001

bibl.seg: RENNER Timothy, The Aesthetics of Hexameter Verses: A New Fragment on Metre in the Michigan Collection.

Bernhard PALME (Hg.), Akten des 23. Internationalen Papyrologenkongresses. Wien, 22.-28. Juli 2001 = Österreichische Akademie der Wissenschaften. Philosophisch-historische Klasse. Kommission für antike Rechtsgeschichte. Papyrologica Vindobonensia. 1 (Wien, 2007) pp. 595-601, 1 fig.

P. Mich. Inv. 6766a verso is characterized in the library's inventory as "grammatical treatise". Fr. 3 focuses on metre rather than prosody or grammar in the strict sense. Homeric verses are quoted. Frs. 1 and 2 will be edited elsewhere. Unknown provenance, II century C.E.
